title: Understanding Self-Harm
text: Self-harm often involves intentionally causing injury to oneself as a way to cope with emotional distress. It is important to recognize the signs to provide help and support.

title: Common Areas for Self-Harm
text: Individuals who self-harm may choose areas of the body that are easily concealable, such as the wrists, arms, thighs, or other less noticeable parts.

hintAnswer: visible cuts, burns, or bruises, frequently observed on wrists, arms, thighs, or other less noticeable body parts
title: Identifying Physical Signs
text: What are some physical signs that might indicate someone is self-harming?
choices: the structured evaluation of the risk factors associated with a person’s potential for engaging in a $$life-threatening$$ behavior, such as suicide
visible cuts, burns, or bruises, frequently observed on wrists, arms, thighs, or other less noticeable body parts
wearing long sleeves or pants even in warm weather to conceal injuries, and the unexplained possession of sharp objects like knives or razors
